entries.title: Initial build — complete architecture from scratch
entries.description: Built the entire dev-track system in one session: server, UI, CLI, data layer, integrations, AI brain, codebase scanner.
items: Hono server on port 24680 with 16 API route files
React + Vite + Tailwind UI with 11 views
CLI with full command set for AI and human use
Shared TypeScript types across server/UI/CLI
File watcher (chokidar) for live sync
WebSocket server for real-time dashboard updates
Script runner for diagnostic execution
8 integration plugins: GitHub, Vercel, Supabase, Sentry, Helicone, Upstash, AWS EC2, Cloudflare
Integration manager with credential storage and test connection
AI Brain system: notes, preferences, context recovery
Ideas system with capture to explore to validate to promote workflow
Codebase scanner: scanned 664 files / 139K lines in 289ms
Universal activity feed aggregating all systems
Cross-platform context sync engine (Cursor, Claude, Copilot, Windsurf, generic)
Cursor rule template with AI autonomy permissions
Dark theme inspired by Linear/Cursor
files_touched: 79 files total across server/, ui/, cli/, shared/, data/, templates/

entries.title: First boot — UI renders successfully in browser
entries.description: Fixed all configuration issues preventing the UI from rendering. All 11 views confirmed working in Chrome.
items: Fixed Tailwind config: absolute content paths so Vite root resolution works
Fixed PostCSS config: explicit tailwind.config.js path
Fixed CSS @import ordering: Google Fonts import moved above @tailwind directives
Fixed codebase scanner: default scan root changed from parent dir to cwd
Cleared stale Pillar codebase analysis cache
Killed stale process on port 24680

entries.title: GitHub repo created and code pushed
entries.description: Created public GitHub repo and pushed all code.
items: Installed GitHub CLI via winget
Created public repo: coleguerin-cmd/dev-track
Pushed 3 commits to master

entries.title: Cursor rule cold-start fix — AI orients on every new conversation
entries.description: Added cold-start instructions to cursor rule so the AI reads context-recovery, session state, and project health on the very first message.
items: Added Cold Start section to cursor rule interaction triggers
Updated both .cursor/rules/dev-track.mdc and templates/dev-track.mdc

entries.title: TypeScript build passes clean
entries.description: Fixed TS build error: 'standard' was not a valid Verbosity type in store.ts defaults. npm run build now passes for both UI and server.
items: Changed 'standard' to 'detailed' in store.ts line 106
ISS-002 resolved

entries.title: Archive/completed sections with reopen for Backlog and Issues
entries.description: Completed items no longer vanish. Backlog has a collapsible Completed section at the bottom with reopen buttons. Issues has a reopen button for resolved items.
items: Added collapsible Completed section to Backlog view
Added Reopen button on completed backlog items
Added Reopen button on resolved issues in detail panel
Added POST /api/v1/backlog/:id/reopen endpoint
Added POST /api/v1/issues/:id/reopen endpoint
Added client API methods for both reopen endpoints
ISS-005 created and resolved

entries.title: GitHub integration rewritten — zero config via local git + gh CLI
entries.description: Replaced the PAT-only GitHub integration with a local-first approach. Layer 1: local git CLI for commit history, branches, diffs (zero config). Layer 2: gh CLI for PRs and CI (zero config if authenticated). Layer 3: PAT as optional fallback.
items: Rewrote server/integrations/github.ts with local git + gh CLI helpers
Added getGitStatus, getGitLog, getGitBranches, getGitDiffStats functions
Added getGhPullRequests, getGhCIStatus, getGhIssues functions
Created new server/routes/git.ts with 7 endpoints
Added /api/v1/git/status, log, branches, diff, prs, ci, summary
Wired git routes into server/index.ts
Added git API client methods to ui/src/api/client.ts
PAT field changed to optional in GitHub plugin setup

entries.title: Cursor rule redesigned — inline briefing replaces cold-start file reads
entries.description: The Quick Status and Last Session Briefing are now baked directly into the cursor rule file. AI sees context immediately without reading any files. Works for any AI platform.
items: Added Last Session Briefing section to cursor rule
Added Warnings section to cursor rule
Added 'How This File Works' section explaining cross-platform portability
Removed cold-start file read instructions (context is inline now)
Updated templates/dev-track.mdc with same pattern

entries.title: Standing Instructions — persistent micro-instructions across AI platforms
entries.description: Added a Standing Instructions section to the cursor rule for behavioral preferences like 'restart servers for me' that persist across conversations and platforms. Instructions live in both the context file and brain/preferences.json.
items: Added Standing Instructions section to cursor rule
Added Standing Instructions section to template
Populated brain/preferences.json with 4 learned preferences and 2 patterns
Instructions: auto-restart servers, bias toward action, aesthetic priority, cross-platform persistence

entries.title: Interactive codebase architecture visualizer with react-flow
entries.description: Built a full graph visualization for the Codebase Explorer. Three views (Module Architecture, File Dependencies, API Route Map), custom nodes, edge tooltips, click-to-highlight, detail panel with layman-friendly descriptions.
items: Installed reactflow and dagre packages
Added GET /api/v1/codebase/graph endpoint with modules/files/routes views
Built CodebaseGraph.tsx with react-flow canvas and dagre auto-layout
Built 4 custom node types: ModuleNode, FileNode, RouteNode, ServiceNode
Built custom edge with hover tooltip showing imported symbols
Built NodeDetailPanel with auto-generated layman descriptions
Added Architecture tab as default tab in Codebase Explorer
Click-to-highlight: click a node, connections light up, rest dims
MiniMap with color-coded nodes, legend, view switcher

entries.title: Codebase scanner — generic module inference replaces Next.js-specific logic
entries.description: The inferModules function was hardcoded for Next.js (lib/, components/, app/api/). Rewrote it to work with any project structure by grouping files by their actual directory paths. Also improved file classification to recognize Hono routes and React views.
items: Rewrote inferModules to use generic directory-based grouping (2-3 level depth)
Added small-module merging (1-2 file groups merge into parent)
Added generateModuleName for readable names (server/routes -> Server Routes)
Fixed classifyFile to recognize Hono route files and /views/ directories
Fixed extractApiRoutes to detect Hono app.get/post patterns
dev-track now shows ~10 modules instead of one giant 'other' blob

entries.title: Plain-English module descriptions for architecture graph
entries.description: Rewrote scanner to generate rich, human-readable descriptions for every module instead of just '8 files, 3 functions'. Descriptions explain what each module does based on its file types, exports, external services, and DB operations. Added shortDescription for graph node display.

entries.title: Relationship labels on graph edges
entries.description: Inter-module edges now show plain-English relationship descriptions ('uses UI components from', 'reads and writes project data', 'renders pages from') instead of '3 imports'. Labels appear on hover and persist when edges are highlighted.

entries.title: Rich module detail panel with descriptions and connections
entries.description: Clicking a module node now shows a full detail panel with: plain-English description, stats, file type breakdown, key exports, connection list with relationship descriptions, and external services. Replaced the old 'click into files' placeholder.

entries.title: Docs view complete overhaul — proper markdown wiki
entries.description: Replaced raw pre-tag markdown dump with a full wiki experience: rendered markdown (react-markdown + remark-gfm), file sidebar with sorted navigation, auto-generated table of contents with click-to-scroll, proper heading styles, code blocks, tables, blockquotes, and full-width layout.

entries.title: AI-in-the-loop foundation: multi-provider service, model router, 25-tool registry
entries.description: Built the complete AI backbone: AIService with unified interface across OpenAI (GPT-5.2/5.3-Codex), Anthropic (Opus 4.6/Sonnet 4.5/Haiku), and Google (Gemini 3 Pro/Flash). Task-aware ModelRouter with fallback chains. Helicone proxy for cost tracking. 25 tools giving the AI full read/write access to backlog, issues, changelog, ideas, codebase, git, docs, brain, state, metrics, and project files.

entries.title: AI chat sidebar: persistent resizable panel with streaming and tool call rendering
entries.description: Built the chat-first AI interface as a persistent right sidebar. Resizable (320-700px drag handle), push layout, model selector dropdown, conversation thread management, SSE streaming with real-time text + tool call events, markdown message rendering, tool call pills with expandable details, suggested prompts for new conversations.

entries.title: AI configuration: data schema, user profiles, feature flags, budget controls
entries.description: Created data/ai/ directory with config.json (provider settings, feature flags, budget limits, model defaults), profiles.json (user profile with technical attributes, communication style, AI instructions), usage.json (cost tracking). Credentials stored in .credentials.json (gitignored).

entries.title: Auto-model-discovery from provider APIs
entries.description: Router now queries Anthropic models.list(), OpenAI models.list(), and Google on startup to auto-discover available models. Pattern-based tier classification (opus=premium, sonnet=standard, haiku=budget) means model name changes never break routing again. Found 58 models across 3 providers.

entries.title: Docs ToC filtering for long documents
entries.description: Fixed ToC sidebar in Docs view flooding with repetitive entries from SPEC. Now filters to h1-h2 only when document has >15 headings. Also skips headings inside code blocks.

entries.title: Fix duplicate AI chat messages
entries.description: Fixed bug where every AI response appeared twice in chat. Both 'message_complete' and 'done' SSE events were adding the message. Now only 'message_complete' adds, and accContent is cleared to prevent double-add.

entries.title: Fix chat resize, model picker, and conversation persistence
entries.description: Fixed resize handle not working (missing e.preventDefault()), model picker race condition (retry when discovery incomplete), conversation persistence across refresh (localStorage), deduplicated model list (58→~15 unique), added conversation delete button, grouped models by provider in dropdown.

entries.title: Fix stale brain notes on dashboard (ISS-009)
entries.description: Dismissed superseded brain notes (BN-003 open source decision replaced by BN-013 paid product, BN-007/BN-008 already actioned). Added superseded_by field. Dashboard now shows only current, relevant AI insights.

entries.title: UI overhaul: Lucide icons, Cursor-minimal design
entries.description: Replaced all emoji icons with Lucide React SVG icons across Sidebar, Dashboard, Ideas, Codebase, Sessions. Redesigned sidebar with grouped navigation sections, tighter spacing, branded logo mark. Redesigned dashboard with clean card components, proper icon system, minimal aesthetic inspired by Cursor/Linear.

entries.title: Settings page redesign with Profile, AI Config, and Integrations tabs
entries.description: Rebuilt Settings page with Cursor-inspired sidebar nav. Three sections: Profile (experience web with sliders, behavior patterns, AI instructions, context notes), AI Configuration (providers, default models with grouped dropdowns, budget controls, feature toggles), and Integrations (existing, cleaned up). Added GET/PUT /ai/profile server endpoints. Expanded user profile schema with behavior patterns (session length, context habits, closure prompting, communication pace).

entries.title: AI-observed profile with intelligence scoring and radar charts
entries.description: Replaced self-reported profile sliders with AI-observed scoring. Added: IQ-scale intelligence score (128) with ring visualization, cognitive profile radar chart (systems thinking, product intuition, pattern recognition, learning velocity, strategic reasoning, communication, technical abstraction, attention to detail), technical skills radar chart (coding, architecture, design, product, devops, data, security, testing). AI assessment notes. All read-only, dynamically updateable. Custom SVG RadarChart component (zero deps). ISS-010 resolved.

entries.title: Notification tray with toast notifications and bell panel
entries.description: Built real-time notification system: toast notifications (auto-dismiss 5s, slide-in animation, max 3 visible), notification bell in header with unread count badge, dropdown panel with full notification history (mark read, clear all). WebSocket file_changed events converted to typed notifications. Dedupe logic for rapid-fire events. Top bar added to App layout. ISS-011 resolved.

entries.title: Issue tracking discipline — create before fix
entries.description: Established discipline of creating ISS-XXX entries BEFORE fixing bugs, not after. ISS-010 (profile self-reporting), ISS-011 (no notifications), ISS-012 (no conversation bridge) all created before work started. This is the first layer of ISS-006 fix — the structural enforcement (session-end audit) is the second layer.

entries.title: Deep cross-project intelligence assessment
entries.description: Audited all 4 projects (Pillar 919 files, Landmark 323 files, Seat-at-Table ~200 files, dev-track ~100 files) plus chat logs, brain notes, session history, and preferences. Built comprehensive cognitive profile: IQ 131 (revised up from 128), 12 detailed assessment notes, deep assessment with cognitive strengths/weaknesses, work style profile, IQ calibration methodology. Added deep assessment display to Settings UI with strengths, growth areas, work style grid, and calibration notes.

entries.title: AI-to-AI operational guidance and session observation pipeline
entries.description: Added ai_to_ai_guidance section to user profile — blunt operational instructions for any AI working with this user. Includes: handling calibration (explanation depth, vocabulary, response length, disagreement style), common failure modes (scope explosion, context burnout, forgetting tracking, sugarcoating, over-planning), what he values, what loses trust, intelligence calibration for AI. Added session_observations array for session-end observation pipeline. Updated cursor rule with session-end observation instruction. Captured IDEA-029.

entries.title: Fix radar chart labels, add observation log UI, sharpen AI-to-AI honesty
entries.description: Fixed radar chart label clipping (increased padding, SVG overflow visible, shortened chart labels while keeping full labels in score grid). Added session observation log display to profile UI showing raw AI-to-AI observations with attribute signals. Sharpened ai_to_ai_guidance with 3 new failure modes (VALIDATION THEATER, FLATTERY TRAP, IDEA SEDUCTION) and 3 new assessment notes (testing blind spot pattern, meta-work seduction risk, emotional volatility management).

entries.title: Honest assessment overhaul — no more softening
entries.description: Expanded AI observations from 4 visible to all (collapsible). Changed 'Growth Areas' to 'Weaknesses' in UI. Added brutally honest assessment notes: cannot code independently, idea generation outpaces execution, vision clarity != communication clarity, Jobs/Woz dynamic, deep distrust of validation, meta-work seduction trap. Lowered attention to detail from 5 to 4. Expanded cognitive weaknesses from 5 to 6 with more operational language. Updated ai_to_ai explanation calibration (he reads detailed plans, just not preambles). Captured IDEA-030 (portable intelligence profile).

entries.title: Dashboard overhaul v2 + profile actionable targets, comparisons, AI dependency
entries.description: Dashboard rebuilt: health ring visualization, compact stats row, collapsible AI briefing, horizontal brain note cards, 3/2 column split (focus+pipeline | activity+changelog+ideas), 'Up Next' pipeline, 'Recently Shipped' changelog. Profile: added actionable development targets with specific advice, comparative framing (vs engineers/founders/AI power users + archetype), AI dependency estimates with progress bars. Intelligence score corrected to 127 with strategy context on testing tradeoffs.

entries.title: Kanban drag-and-drop (ISS-004 resolved)
entries.description: Wired up @dnd-kit/core in Backlog.tsx. DndContext wrapper, useDroppable columns keyed by horizon, useDraggable cards, DragOverlay with card preview, PointerSensor with 8px activation distance so clicks still work. Drop zone highlighting (blue ring on hover, dashed outline during drag). Button-based moves kept as fallback.

entries.title: AI provider API key management in Settings UI
entries.description: Added API Keys card to Settings > AI Configuration. Password inputs with show/hide toggle for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and Helicone. Masked key display on load. Save button calls PUT /api/v1/ai/credentials. Per-provider Test Connection button calls new POST /api/v1/ai/providers/:id/test endpoint that verifies keys by attempting API calls (list models for OpenAI, minimal message for Anthropic, generate for Google, query for Helicone). Inline pass/fail results.

entries.title: Multi-project distribution architecture — dogfood-ready
entries.description: Major refactor: all server files now use centralized project-config.ts instead of hardcoded process.cwd()/data paths. Created ~/.dev-track/ central registry with per-project data directories. CLI commands: 'dev-track init' scaffolds a new project (.dev-track/config.json in project, data at ~/.dev-track/projects/<id>/data/, cursor rule from template, gitignore update, project registry). 'dev-track start' launches server with correct data dir and project root. 'dev-track projects' lists all registered projects. Server accepts --data-dir, --port, --project-root flags. New endpoints: GET /api/v1/project (current project info), GET /api/v1/projects (all registered). Sidebar shows project name prominently with 'dev-track' as subtle branding below. Tested: Pillar initialized successfully with isolated data, server boots clean pointing at Pillar data.

entries.title: Consolidate API keys into Integrations tab (ISS-013 resolved)
entries.description: Moved all AI provider API key management (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Helicone) from AI Configuration tab into Integrations tab as a top-level 'AI Providers' section. 2x2 grid layout with per-provider key input, show/hide toggle, and Test Connection button. AI Configuration tab now only contains: provider enable/disable toggles (with cross-reference to Integrations for key setup), model defaults, budget controls, and feature toggles. Added 'Development Tools' subheader to separate AI providers from integration plugins below.

entries.title: In-app project switcher with hot-swap (ISS-014 resolved)
entries.description: Built project switcher dropdown in sidebar header. When multiple projects are registered, a chevron appears next to the project name. Click opens a dropdown showing all registered projects with names, paths, and active indicator. POST /api/v1/projects/switch endpoint hot-swaps the data directory, project root, reloads the Store, and restarts the file watcher — all without restarting the server process. Watcher made restartable (closes old chokidar instance, starts new one on new data dir). Page reloads after switch to refresh all cached view data.

entries.title: Remove Helicone from AI Providers section — lives in Dev Tools only
entries.description: Removed Helicone from the AI Providers grid in Integrations tab. Helicone has its own full plugin entry in Dev Tools below with proper credential fields (including org ID). AI Providers section now shows only the 3 direct AI providers: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google in a 3-column grid.

entries.title: Helicone org ID field + credential sync to AI proxy (ISS-015 resolved)
entries.description: Added Organization ID credential field to Helicone integration plugin. Updated IntegrationManager to sync Helicone credentials (api_key → ai.helicone, org_id → ai.helicone_org_id) to the AI proxy namespace when saved. Users now configure Helicone in one place (Integrations tab) and the AI proxy automatically picks up the key and org ID for routing requests through Helicone. Captured IDEA-031 (encrypted key transfer for cross-project credential sharing).

entries.title: Modular AI tool registry — 40 tools across 16 domains (ISS-016 resolved)
entries.description: Replaced monolithic tools.ts (718-line switch statement) with a modular registry at server/ai/tools/. 16 domain modules: backlog, issues, changelog, ideas, state, brain, session, actions, codebase, git, files, docs, metrics, config, profiles, integrations. Each module is self-contained (definitions + executors in one file). Registry auto-collects all tools from all modules. ~40 total tools. New capabilities added: update_project_state, update_idea, start/end_session, Actions full CRUD, context_recovery read/write, preferences read/write, user_profile read/write + add_session_observation, write_project_file, list_directory, scan_codebase (trigger fresh scan), detailed git_log (full messages, dates, since/path filters), git_branches, update_velocity, project_config read/write, list_registered_projects, get_integrations_status, test_integration. Adding new tools = create new file in tools/ directory and add to MODULES array.

entries.title: Fix Changelog crash, Ideas click bug, Docs ToC scroll (ISS-017/018/019)
entries.description: Changelog: added null safety on entry.items and entry.files_touched, helper for files_changed/files_touched field name mismatch, added type/scope display. Ideas: added optional chaining on all array accesses (pros, cons, open_questions). Docs: fixed ToC scroll to use container-relative offset instead of scrollIntoView (which fails in nested overflow containers).
